title: Replace TaskModal with new task detail modal design
problem: Current TaskModal needs to be replaced with the new task detail modal design. The new modal should provide full task editing capabilities with a clean, modern UI.
scope:
Replace src/components/TaskModal.tsx with new implementation:
- Tabbed interface (Details, History)
- Full form fields: Status (lane), Priority, Owner (agent names), Problem, Scope, Acceptance Criteria
- Status dropdown: Proposed, Queued, Development, Review, Done (maps to lane field)
- Owner dropdown: Shows agent names (TARS, Forge, Patch, Sentinel, Blueprint) not IDs
- History tab shows statusHistory array with lane transitions
- Save Changes calls PUT /api/tasks/:id
- Remove Copy JSON button
- Open modal when clicking any task card
acceptanceCriteria: TaskModal.tsx completely replaced with new design
Modal opens when clicking any task card on the board
Tabs: Details and History (active tab highlighted with blue underline)
Details tab shows: Status dropdown (lane values), Priority dropdown (P0-P3), Owner dropdown (agent names)
Details tab shows: Problem textarea, Scope textarea, Acceptance Criteria textarea
All fields load current task data from API
Save Changes button calls PUT /api/tasks/:id with all modified fields
Status dropdown maps to lane field (Proposed→proposed, Queued→queued, Development→development, Review→review, Done→done)
Owner dropdown shows agent names (fetch from /api/agents, display name field, save as agent.id)
History tab displays statusHistory array showing lane transitions with timestamps
Modal header shows task type badge (Epic, UI, Backend, etc.) and task ID
Footer shows: Cancel button (closes modal), Save Changes button (saves and closes)
Copy JSON button removed from footer
Styling matches reference file (dark theme, rounded corners, smooth animations)
Modal closes on backdrop click or X button
Code pushed to GitHub and Docker container updated

title: Redesign Mission Control UI with new design system
problem: Current Mission Control UI needs to match the new design specification provided by Logan. The UI must be fully functional with real data from our APIs, not placeholders.
scope:
Update src/pages/MissionControl.tsx to implement the new design with:
- Agent status strip (compact/expanded modes based on active agents)
- Kanban columns (proposed, queued, development, review, done)
- Blocked tasks bar (collapsible)
- Activity feed sidebar
- Task cards with priority dots, tags, and owner indicators
- Real-time data from /api/tasks, /api/agents, /api/live, /api/activity
- DM Sans font from Google Fonts
- Exact colors and styling from reference file
acceptanceCriteria: Agent strip shows expanded cards when <4 active, compact mode when >=4 active
All data comes from real API endpoints (no mock data)
Task cards show priority (P0/P1/P2/P3) with correct colors
Task cards show tags (Epic, UI, Backend, QA, etc.) with correct colors
Blocked tasks bar is collapsible and shows all blocked tasks
Activity feed shows recent events from /api/activity
Navigation bar matches design (Mission Control, Projects, Activity, etc.)
Board header shows total tasks, critical count, blocked count
+ New task button is functional
Column overflow shows +N more button when >5 tasks
All styling matches reference file exactly (colors, spacing, borders, shadows)
Code pushed to GitHub and Docker container updated
